Test Case Title: Valid user login with correct credentials
Preconditions: User account exists (admin@example.com/password), Application is accessible
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter email: admin@example.com
3. Enter password: password
4. Click 'Sign In' button
Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to Command Overview dashboard

Preconditions: User account exists, Application is accessible
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter valid email: admin@example.com
3. Enter wrong password: wrongpass
4. Click 'Sign In' button
Expected Result: Error message displayed: 'Invalid Email or password'. User remains on login page

Preconditions: Application is accessible
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter non-existent email: fake@test.com
3. Enter any password
4. Click 'Sign In' button
Expected Result: Error message displayed: 'Invalid Email or password'. User remains on login page

Preconditions: Application is accessible
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Leave email field empty
3. Leave password field empty
4. Click 'Sign In' button
Expected Result: Validation error displayed. Form not submitted

Preconditions: Application is accessible
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Observe page layout
Expected Result: NERV logo visible, 'GOD'S IN HIS HEAVEN' motto displayed, Dark theme applied

Preconditions: User is logged in
Test Steps:
1. Click on user avatar/name in sidebar
2. Click 'Disconnect' button
Expected Result: User is logged out and redirected to login page

Preconditions: User is logged in
Test Steps:
1. Refresh the browser page
2. Observe application state
Expected Result: User remains logged in and on the same page

Preconditions: User is logged in, Session has expired
Test Steps:
1. Wait for session to expire (or manually expire)
2. Try to access any protected page
Expected Result: User is redirected to login page with appropriate message

Preconditions: User is logged in as any role
Test Steps:
1. Login to application
2. Observe dashboard page
Expected Result: Dashboard displays: stat cards (Missions, Operations, Protocols, Operators), Recent Operations list, MAGI Status indicator

Preconditions: User is logged in, Projects/Test Runs exist in database
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Compare stat card values with actual database counts
Expected Result: All stat cards (Missions, Operations, Protocols, Operators) show accurate counts matching database

Preconditions: User is logged in, Test runs with results exist
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Locate Pass Rate Trend section
3. Observe chart
Expected Result: Line chart displays showing pass rate over last 30 days with accurate data points

Preconditions: User is logged in, Test activity exists
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Locate Activity Heatmap section
Expected Result: GitHub-style heatmap displays with color intensity reflecting activity levels

Preconditions: User is logged in, Failed test cases exist
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Locate Top Failed Tests section
Expected Result: List shows test cases with highest failure rates with accurate counts

Preconditions: User is logged in, Recent test activities exist
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Locate Team Activity section
Expected Result: Recent activities displayed with operator names and timestamps

Preconditions: User is logged in
Test Steps:
1. Click on each stat card
2. Click on items in Recent Operations list
Expected Result: Each link navigates to the correct page

Preconditions: User is logged in, Mobile viewport
Test Steps:
1. Resize browser to mobile width
2. Observe dashboard layout
Expected Result: Dashboard elements stack properly and remain usable

Test Case Title: Projects index page displays all projects
Preconditions: User is logged in, Multiple projects exist
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Projects (Missions) page
2. Observe project list
Expected Result: All projects displayed as cards with name and description and stats

Preconditions: User is logged in as Admin
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Projects page
2. Click 'Initialize Mission' button
3. Enter project name: 'Test Project'
4. Enter description
5. Click 'Initialize' button
Expected Result: New project created successfully. Redirected to project show page

Preconditions: User is logged in as Manager
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Projects page
2. Click 'Initialize Mission' button
3. Enter valid project details
4. Submit form
Expected Result: New project created successfully

Preconditions: User is logged in as Tester
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Projects page
2. Look for 'Initialize Mission' button
Expected Result: Button not visible or returns unauthorized error if accessed directly

Preconditions: User is logged in as Admin, Project 'E-commerce Platform' exists
Test Steps:
1. Try to create project with name 'E-commerce Platform'
2. Submit form
Expected Result: Validation error displayed: name must be unique

Preconditions: User is logged in as Admin
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to new project form
2. Leave name field empty
3. Submit form
Expected Result: Validation error displayed: name is required

Preconditions: User is logged in, Project exists
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Projects page
2. Click on a project card
Expected Result: Project detail page displays with test suites and test runs sections

Preconditions: User is logged in as project owner
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to owned project
2. Click 'Modify Mission' button
3. Change project name/description
4. Save changes
Expected Result: Project updated successfully

Preconditions: User is logged in as Admin, Not project owner
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to any project
2. Click 'Modify Mission' button
3. Make changes
4. Save
Expected Result: Project updated successfully (Admin can edit any project)

Preconditions: User is logged in as Tester
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to project
2. Look for edit button
Expected Result: Edit button not visible or returns unauthorized

Preconditions: User is logged in as Admin
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to project
2. Click 'Terminate Mission' button
3. Confirm deletion
Expected Result: Project and all related data deleted. Redirected to projects list

Preconditions: User is logged in as Manager/Tester
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to project
2. Look for delete button
Expected Result: Delete button not visible or returns unauthorized

Preconditions: Valid API token exists
Test Steps: 1. Send GET /api/v1/projects with Authorization: Bearer <token>
Expected Result: Returns 200 with projects list

Test Case Title: API authentication fails with invalid token
Preconditions: No valid token
Test Steps: 1. Send GET /api/v1/projects with Authorization: Bearer invalid_token
Expected Result: Returns 401 Unauthorized

Preconditions: No token provided
Test Steps: 1. Send GET /api/v1/projects without Authorization header
Expected Result: Returns 401 Unauthorized

Preconditions: Valid API token
Test Steps: 1. Send GET /api/v1/projects
Expected Result: Returns JSON array of all projects

Preconditions: Valid API token, Project exists
Test Steps: 1. Send GET /api/v1/projects/:id
Expected Result: Returns JSON with project details including test suites

Preconditions: Valid API token, Project with test runs
Test Steps: 1. Send GET /api/v1/projects/:id/test_runs
Expected Result: Returns JSON array of test runs with status counts

Preconditions: Valid API token
Test Steps: 1. Send POST /api/v1/projects/:id/test_runs with name and test_suite_ids
Expected Result: Returns 201 with created test run

Test Case Title: Get test run details via API
Preconditions: Valid API token, Test run exists
Test Steps: 1. Send GET /api/v1/test_runs/:id
Expected Result: Returns JSON with full test run including test cases

Test Case Title: Update test case status via API
Preconditions: Valid API token, Test run case exists
Test Steps: 1. Send PATCH /api/v1/test_run_cases/:id with status: passed
Expected Result: Returns updated test run case with new status

Test Case Title: Bulk update test cases via API
Preconditions: Valid API token, Multiple test run cases
Test Steps: 1. Send POST /api/v1/test_run_cases/bulk_update with updates array
Expected Result: Returns summary of updated cases

Preconditions: Valid API token, Test run with cypress_id test cases
Test Steps: 1. Send POST /api/v1/test_runs/:id/cypress_results with results array
Expected Result: Returns summary of processed results

Test Case Title: Get test case by Cypress ID
Preconditions: Valid API token, Test case with cypress_id exists
Test Steps: 1. Send GET /api/v1/test_cases/by_cypress_id/:cypress_id
Expected Result: Returns test case details
